Leaves: Typical Sheoak (Casuarinaceae), tiny leaves form rings around long thin drooping branchlets in segments.
Flowers: Small, in dense groupings at the end of branches.
FruitSeeds: Clustered in a cone 1-2 cm long.
DistinguishingFeatures: Very hard to distinguish from other Sheoaks (Casuarinaceae) and can hybridise.
